result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie G. Bremer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
May serve the last half on Electronic Monitor.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Pursue fulltime employment or school or combination for fulltime.
Pursue psychological evaluation if recommended by agent and comply with any treatment recommendations.
Not to be at Kohls Department Store in the Village of Plover.
Cooperate with any other assessment deemed appropriate by the agent and comply with treatment.
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if any recommended.

timeConds.notes:
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Eligible to be evaluated for Electronic Monitor if she qualifies, she may serve the entire probationary conditions on electronic monitor.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence she is currently serving.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stephanie G. Bremer in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Stephanie G. Bremer in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
8:38 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.  Makes additional statements. 
Defendant concurs with agreement as stated. 

Defendant enters a plea of:  GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Defendant agrees with prior convictions. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Serve 9 months jail - STAYED -
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.
May serve the last half on electronic monitor.

Placed on probation for 36 months:
Serve 30 days jail, consecutive to any sentence she is currently serving .
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Eligible to be evaluated for Electronic Monitor if she qualifies, she may serve the entire probationary condition on electronic monitor. 
18 days credit. 
Pursue fulltime employment or school or combination for fulltime.
Not to be at Kohls Department Store in the Village of Plover. 
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if any recommended.
Pursue psychological evaluation if recommend by agent and comply with any treatment recommendations.
Cooperate with any other assessment deemed appropriate by the agent and comply with treatment. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.

Pre-trial conference at 06-08-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Stephanie G. Bremer in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Defendant doesn't need to be present for pretrial conference.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.
